title: Wolfish - Erica Berry
description: I grabbed this at random from my library end cap, super solid read! This book explores the wolf as a symbol of fear, telling stories of safety, coexistence, and conservation. I really enjoyed this, it kept me on my toes and told a variety of interesting tales.

title: The Long Way to a Small, Angry Planet - Becky Chambers
description: This is just a super wholesome book. Interesting sci-fi and exploration elements while still retaining a very human quality to it. Very heart-warming read that will leave you smiling. I expected more action tbh, but I’m happy with this amount because action makes me anxious lol.

title: These Precious Days - Ann Patchett
description: I feared this one would make me weep and it did. ON A PLANE!!! very digestible and poignant short stories from the author's life. a mix of bittersweet, heartwarming, and feel-good. these really are some precious days.

title: Silence - Shusaku Endo
description: A library recommendation from my boyfriend. This one is a thinker. The book follows a priest's grappling with his religion as he, and many others, are being persecuted for it. Lots of ambiguity and very little right or wrong.
